PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

NOTE: Please print all proper names and places names in capital letters. If you are not sure the name is correct as you have given it, please say so. It is quite acceptable to have someone else do the writing at your dictation.

1. Your full name: Livsey Frank
2. Your address: Oliver Lodge
3. Date: March 27, 1962
4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country): Larnach, England
5. What was your father's name and occupation?: Alfred Leroy, Cotton Spinner
6. When did you come to Saskatoon? (Give month and year): August 1912
7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatoon, giving dates wherever possible: Winnipeg 1910
8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you may use "I was a small child", "I was in my teens", etc.): 31 years old
9. What were your reasons for coming West?: To try and better myself
10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it?): Through Library book
11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada? They didn't object.

12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends, etc.)? By train & all.

13. What means of transportation did you use? John & then & finally by C.P.R.

14. What incidents of the journey best do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other excitement, etc.)

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan? At Verkin.

16. Where did you settle or take up land? Near.

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan. At Qu'Appelle for a year. Then to Weyburn for 5 years. Then to Saskatoon.

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How, after you came?

Kamalott family farm for 5 years.

Wheat for farmers.
11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada? They thought it was a good idea.

13. What means of transportation did you use? By train.

14. What incidents of the journey do you remember? People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other excitement, etc.

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan? At Regina.

16. Where did you settle or take up land? Near Regina.

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan. At Regina for a year, then to Saskatoon for 5 years.

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How, after you came? Working for farmers.
